metas.name: Parks and Recreation
metas.description: Given your enjoyment of 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia,' 'The Good Place,' and 'Ted Lasso,' this show offers a similarly optimistic and hilarious ensemble comedy with a focus on quirky characters and heartwarming moments.

metas.name: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
metas.description: Your appreciation for workplace comedies like 'Scrubs' and 'The Office' (which you haven't listed but is a likely companion) will translate well to this witty and fast-paced sitcom about a diverse group of detectives.

metas.name: Community
metas.description: Fans of meta-humor and unconventional storytelling, as seen in 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia' and 'Rick and Morty,' will find a lot to love in this show's clever deconstruction of sitcom tropes.

metas.name: What We Do in the Shadows
metas.description: If you enjoy the mockumentary style and absurdist humor of shows like 'Peep Show' and the character-driven comedy of 'It's Always Sunny,' this supernatural sitcom will be a perfect fit.

metas.name: Abbott Elementary
metas.description: This show shares the heartwarming and comedic tone of 'Ted Lasso' and the mockumentary style of 'The Office,' focusing on dedicated teachers in an underfunded public school.

metas.name: Schitt's Creek
metas.description: Your taste for character growth and evolving relationships, as seen in 'The Good Place' and 'Master of None,' will be richly rewarded by this show's transformation of its spoiled protagonists.

metas.name: The Office (US)
metas.description: A classic workplace comedy with a similar mockumentary feel to 'Peep Show' and plenty of character-driven humor, aligning with your enjoyment of 'Scrubs' and 'Parks and Recreation'.

metas.name: Archer
metas.description: For fans of witty dialogue, adult animation, and absurd situations, similar to 'Rick and Morty' and 'Futurama,' this spy-fi comedy offers sharp writing and hilarious espionage.

metas.name: Bojack Horseman
metas.description: While it has deeper themes, its sharp satire, dark humor, and innovative animation will appeal to your appreciation for 'Rick and Morty,' 'The Simpsons,' and 'Atlanta.'

metas.name: Silicon Valley
metas.description: This show captures the awkward humor and relatable struggles of a group of tech entrepreneurs, echoing the comedic sensibilities of 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia' and 'Master of None.'

metas.name: Bluey
metas.description: For pure, unadulterated joy and clever storytelling that appeals to all ages, much like the feel-good elements of 'Ted Lasso' and the imaginative scope of animated shows.

metas.name: The Great British Bake Off
metas.description: This reality competition is the epitome of lighthearted, feel-good television, offering a gentle, positive environment that contrasts with the chaos of 'It's Always Sunny.'

metas.name: Taskmaster
metas.description: A brilliant comedy panel show that's incredibly light and fun, with creative challenges and hilarious contestant interactions, appealing to your taste for observational humor and silliness.

metas.name: Loki
metas.description: Given your enjoyment of 'Doctor Who' and the sci-fi/fantasy elements in 'Rick and Morty' and 'Angels of Death,' this MCU series offers fun, time-bending adventures with a charismatic lead.

metas.name: Doctor Who (2005)
metas.description: Since you enjoyed the newer 'Doctor Who' (2024), exploring the revival series from 2005 onwards offers a vast library of fun, adventurous, and often quirky sci-fi stories.

metas.name: Wellington Paranormal
metas.description: From the creators of 'What We Do in the Shadows,' this mockumentary follows two clueless police officers dealing with supernatural events, perfect for fans of dry wit and absurdity.

metas.name: Dave
metas.description: If you enjoy the blend of comedy and relatable life struggles found in 'Atlanta' and 'Master of None,' this show offers a funny and often poignant look at the rap music industry.

metas.name: Only Murders in the Building
metas.description: This charming mystery-comedy is full of wit, great characters, and a cozy vibe, fitting for viewers who appreciate the humor in 'The Good Place' and 'Parks and Recreation.'

metas.name: Letterkenny
metas.description: For fans of rapid-fire dialogue and quirky, down-to-earth humor, similar to 'Peep Show' and 'Goodness Gracious Me,' this Canadian gem is a must-watch.

metas.name: The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel
metas.description: This show is visually stunning and features incredibly witty dialogue and a charismatic lead, offering a feel-good, aspirational comedy reminiscent of 'Ted Lasso.'

metas.name: Fleabag
metas.description: While it has dramatic undertones, its sharp, observational humor and unconventional narrative style will appeal to your appreciation for shows like 'Master of None' and 'Atlanta.'

metas.name: The IT Crowd
metas.description: A classic British sitcom with a cult following, offering absurd humor and relatable (if eccentric) characters, similar to the spirit of 'Peep Show' and 'It's Always Sunny.'

metas.name: Garth Marenghi's Darkplace
metas.description: If you enjoy intentionally bad-good genre parodies like 'Angels of Death' or 'Dirk Gently' can sometimes be, this cult classic offers hilariously awful 80s sci-fi horror.

metas.name: Star Trek: Lower Decks
metas.description: This animated series offers the same blend of sci-fi adventure and witty, character-driven comedy that you enjoyed in 'Rick and Morty' and 'Futurama.'

metas.name: American Dad!
metas.description: From the creators of 'Family Guy,' this animated sitcom offers a similar brand of satire and absurdity, aligning with your enjoyment of 'The Simpsons' and 'Futurama.'

metas.name: Disenchantment
metas.description: If you appreciate the animation style and comedic fantasy elements of 'Futurama' and 'The Simpsons,' this show from Matt Groening offers a similar experience.

metas.name: Bob's Burgers
metas.description: This animated sitcom is known for its quirky characters, heartwarming family dynamics, and offbeat humor, offering a gentler comedic experience than 'It's Always Sunny' but with similar character focus.

metas.name: Young Justice
metas.description: For fans of action-adventure animated series with engaging characters and a sense of fun, akin to 'Angels of Death' and 'One-Punch Man,' this superhero show is a great choice.

metas.name: Barry
metas.description: While it delves into darker territory, the show expertly balances its humor and violence, offering a unique comedic take on crime and self-discovery that might appeal to fans of 'Atlanta' and 'Dirk Gently.'

metas.name: Toast of London
metas.description: This surreal British sitcom about a struggling actor offers a unique brand of humor and absurdity that fans of 'Peep Show' and 'It's Always Sunny' might appreciate.

metas.name: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend
metas.description: A musical comedy-drama with incredible heart, sharp writing, and a unique narrative style, this show shares the creative spirit of 'The Good Place' and the character depth of 'Master of None.'

metas.name: Impractical Jokers
metas.description: This hidden gem of a reality show is pure, lighthearted fun, with friends pranking each other in public, offering a pure dose of silliness.

metas.name: Stath Lets Flats
metas.description: A hilariously awkward and charming comedy about a incompetent Greek-Cypriot man working in the London lettings industry. It has the cringe humor you might enjoy from 'Peep Show'.

metas.name: Detectorists
metas.description: This is a wonderfully gentle and understated comedy about two friends who love metal detecting. It's full of dry wit and a quiet joy that viewers of 'Ted Lasso' might find appealing.

metas.name: Inside No. 9
metas.description: This anthology series offers a dark, twisted, and often hilarious take on storytelling, with each episode having a surprising twist. It shares a creative and genre-bending spirit with 'Dirk Gently' and 'The Good Place.'

metas.name: Avenue 5
metas.description: From the creator of 'Veep,' this sci-fi comedy offers sharp satire and a dysfunctional ensemble cast navigating a space cruise gone awry, appealing to your enjoyment of 'It's Always Sunny's' chaos.

metas.name: Futurama
metas.description: Since you've watched 'Futurama,' and enjoyed shows like 'Rick and Morty' and 'The Simpsons,' you might enjoy similar animated sci-fi comedies that push the boundaries of humor and imagination.

metas.name: Hacks
metas.description: This show offers a fantastic blend of comedy and drama, with sharp writing and compelling character dynamics, much like 'Master of None' and 'Atlanta,' but with a focus on the cutthroat world of comedy.

metas.name: Wasted
metas.description: A very British and very funny comedy about four friends who are generally failing at life. It offers a similar dose of awkward humor that fans of 'Peep Show' would enjoy.
